title: Ambassador of Australia for Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation
text: The Ambassador of Australia for Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation is an officer of the Australian <a href="Department%20of%20Foreign%20Affairs%20and%20Trade%20%28Australia%29">Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade</a> and the head of the delegation of the Commonwealth of Australia to the <a href="Asia-Pacific%20Economic%20Cooperation">Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation</a> (APEC), based with its secretariat in <a href="Singapore">Singapore</a>. The position has the rank and status of an <a href="Ambassador%20Extraordinary%20and%20Plenipotentiary">Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary</a> and has been sent since March 1996, when Deputy Prime Minister and Minister for Trade <a href="Tim%20Fischer">Tim Fischer</a> appointed Peter Grey as the first Ambassador, although APEC has existed since 1989.
